reference: David Diez's Gmail Account, early months of 2012. All personally identifiable information has been removed.
title: Sample of 50 emails
description:
Description
This is a subsample of the email dataset.

parameters.re_subj: Whether the subject started with “Re:”, “RE:”, “re:”, or “rE:”
parameters.spam: Indicator for whether the email was spam.
parameters.winner: Indicates whether “winner” appeared in the email.
parameters.format: Indicates whether the email was written using HTML (e.g. may have included bolding or active links).
parameters.from: Whether the message was listed as from anyone (this is usually set by default for regular outgoing email).
parameters.urgent_subj: Whether the word “urgent” was in the email subject.
parameters.num_char: The number of characters in the email, in thousands.
parameters.line_breaks: The number of line breaks in the email (does not count text wrapping).
parameters.number: Factor variable saying whether there was no number, a small number (under 1 million), or a big number.
parameters.exclaim_subj: Whether there was an exclamation point in the subject.
parameters.to_multiple: Indicator for whether the email was addressed to more than one recipient.
parameters.time: Time at which email was sent.
parameters.dollar: The number of times a dollar sign or the word “dollar” appeared in the email.
parameters.inherit: The number of times “inherit” (or an extension, such as “inheritance”) appeared in the email.
parameters.sent_email: Indicator for whether the sender had been sent an email in the last 30 days.
parameters.exclaim_mess: The number of exclamation points in the email message.
parameters.password: The number of times “password” appeared in the email.
parameters.viagra: The number of times “viagra” appeared in the email.

format: A data frame with 50 observations on the following 21 variables.
